channel.title: Midtown West on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Midtown West on Table41NYC

item.title: Churrascaria Plataforma
item.description: I like this place more than Fogo De Chao. Granted, I have not been to the NY location as of this writing. I’ve been to the LA location twice. The seasoning at this location to me was better. The salad bar was a let down comparably though. It’s small, and they have sushi there which I thought was odd. I still think M-Grill is the best as far as seasoning and char.

item.title: Ipanema
item.description: The food was surprisingly good, and it’s not pricey at all. They give you free sides of rice and beans, so no worries about ordering that.

item.title: Chirp
item.description: The lomo saltado was ok. The sauces cost 60 cents extra.

item.title: Topaz Noodle Bar
item.description: This place was really good for Thai food. Would love to come back again for their Tom Yum noodle soup and their soft shell crab special. Price was not expensive at all either.

item.title: Lady M Cake Boutique
item.description: This was in a small mall, and it was pretty good. We got the eclairs and apple flan.

item.title: Yoon Haeundae Galbi
item.description: The food was actually surprisingly good. I would come back here again for Korean. The galbi was pretty tasty and the price wasn’t too expensive I think. The meat quality is good.

item.title: Gallagher's Steakhouse
item.description: The cream of spinach tastes like Lawry’s. The horseradish cream was good. The prime rib not as good as Keen’s.

item.title: Keens
item.description: Best prime rib I have ever had. They are known for their mutton chops though, but damn… this prime rib is that good!

item.title: Lobster Press
item.description: This is Marc Forgione’s fast food-ish restaurant near Penn Station. I got the chili lobster here, but it’s not as good as having it at the restaurant. It’s also CLOSED.

item.title: Totto Ramen
item.description: I think this is still one of my top favorite ramen places in NYC. It’s cash only.

item.title: Mentoku Ramen
item.description: It seems I only wrote “pretty good” on my spreadsheet, and right now I am drawing a blank about this place.

item.title: Riko Peruvian Cuisine
item.description: So bad. The lomo saltado is really dry. Can’t seem to find a decent lomo saltado in NYC.

item.title: Ootoya
item.description: Pretty good bento boxing place. A little pricey but no need to tip.

item.title: Sake Bar Hagi
item.description: Decent yakitori skewers, but that’s about it. A bit pricey and always a line.

item.title: Kreuther Chocolate
item.description: Across from Bryant Park. Expensive AF chocolate ($3 pp), but the other desserts were amazing. Really good chocolate though.

item.title: Maison Kayser
item.description: The Christmas log is good. A lot of Frenchy desserts.

item.title: Daisy May's Bbq
item.description: Terrible BBQ. Go here for cheap stale dry meats in tourist hell. Oh apparently it’s permanently closed.

item.title: The Ragtrader and Bo Beep Cocktail
item.description: Interesting bar. Bar upstairs is cool. Piano bar downstairs is really KEWL.
